STATE OF MICHIGAN
GRETCHEN WHITMER DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING DIRECTOR
June 1, 2021
Richard Doud, Jr.
Good Samaritan Rescue Mission
713 9th Street
Bay City, MI 48708
RE: License #: CI090396004
Investigation #: 2021C0106019
Good Samaritan Rescue Mission
Dear Mr. Doud, Jr.:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
611 W. OTTAWA • P.O. BOX 30664 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/lara • 517-335-1980

Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure
611 W. OTTAWA • P.O. BOX 30664 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/lara • 517-335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF LICENSING AND REGULATORY AFFAIRS
BUREAU OF COMMUNITY AND HEALTH SYSTEMS
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI090396004
Investigation #: 2021C0106019
Complaint Receipt Date: 03/30/2021
Investigation Initiation Date: 03/31/2021
Report Due Date: 05/29/2021
Licensee Name: City Rescue of Saginaw Inc.
Licensee Address: 1021 Burt Street
Saginaw, MI 48607
Licensee Telephone #: Unknown
Administrator: Daniel Streeter, Designee
Licensee Designee: Daniel Streeter, Designee
Name of Facility: Good Samaritan Rescue Mission
Facility Address: 713 9th Street
Bay City, MI 48708
Facility Telephone #: (989) 893-5973
Original Issuance Date: 01/25/2021
License Status: ORIGINAL
Effective Date: 01/25/2021
Expiration Date: 07/24/2021
Capacity: 10
Program Type: CHILD CARING INSTITUTION, PRIVATE
1

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
Youth engaged in sexual intercourse with another youth at the No
facility.
III. METHODOLOGY
03/30/2021 Special Investigation Intake
2021C0106019
03/31/2021 Special Investigation Initiated - Telephone
Telephone interview with Consultant 1.
04/13/2021 Contact - Face to Face
Interviewed Administrator 1 and Supervisor 1 at the facility.
05/27/2021 Contact - Telephone call made.
Telephone interview with Youth A and mother.
05/27/2021 Contact - Telephone call made.
Telephone interview with Youth B and father.
05/28/2021 Exit Conference
Exit Conference with Administrator 1.
06/01/2021 Exit Conference
2nd Exit Conference with Administrator 1.
ALLEGATION: Youth engaged in sexual intercourse with another youth at
the facility.
INVESTIGATION:
It was alleged by Youth A that around midnight on 03/27/2021 Youth A performed oral
sex on Youth B and received anal sex from Youth B.
I contacted Consultant 1 on 03/31/2021 for information about this recently licensed
facility. Consultant 1 reported this is a recently licensed short term facility with little
placement history.
2

I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 04/13/2021. Staff 1 stated she is a direct care staff
and is also an educational liaison. Staff 1 aided in providing related documentation that
was requested. Staff 1 reported that Youth A told Staff 1 that Youth A wanted to go to
the hospital for an HIV test. Staff 1 asked why, and Youth A reported he wasn’t feeling
well, had an upset stomach and Youth A and Youth B had sex the previous night. Staff
1 stated Youth A alleged he performed oral sex on Youth B and Youth B performed anal
sex on Youth A. Youth A alleged it happened around midnight on 03/27/2021 and they
were done by 12:20 AM on 03/27/2021. Staff 1 interviewed Youth B about activities the
previous night without presenting the allegations by Youth A. Youth B reported he used
his computer and the only interaction between Youth A and Youth B was their typical
conversation. Staff 1 documented checking with other staff and reviewing the logbook
and based on their conversations the staff had doubts about the truth of Youth A’s
allegations but referred it to Administrator 1 for follow up.
I interviewed Administrator 1 at the facility on 04/13/2021. Administrator 1 stated that
both youth involved in the alleged incident have been discharged from the facility.
Administrator 1 provided contact information for me to contact the youth involved.
Administrator 1 stated he contacted the parents of Youth A and Youth B about the
allegations. Administrator 1 described Youth A as having a history of inappropriate
sexual behaviors or allegations.
Administrator 1 reported he interviewed Youth B about Youth A’s allegations.
Administrator 1 stated Youth B stated he was straight and denied the allegations.
Administrator 1 described Youth B’s body language as being consistent with telling the
truth. Youth B admitted he was on his computer and showed Administrator 1 his you
tube history and emails. There were no emails to Youth A.
Administrator 1 reported he interviewed Youth A about the allegations. Youth A
reported Youth B asked Youth A via email if Youth A wanted or did oral sex. Youth A
also alleged Youth B penetrated Youth A but did not say where or with what. Youth A
stated it was consensual.
I interviewed Youth A’s mother by telephone on 05/27/2021. Youth A’s mother said she
has heard Youth A’s “side of the story” and reported that to her knowledge the police
are not involved. I interviewed Youth A by telephone on 05/27/2021. Youth A did not
go into detail about what allegedly happened. Youth A stated the staff were doing room
checks every 15 minutes. Youth A stated the incident was only once and lasted about
10 minutes. Youth A stated they were both in the same room with 5 beds in the room.
Youth A stated he was at the facility for 30 days and it was helpful. Youth A did not say
anything negative about the facility and staff and seemed to be concerned that Youth
A’s allegations would have a negative impact on the facility.
I interviewed Youth B’s father by telephone on 05/27/2021. Youth B’s father stated the
police had spoken to Youth B and indicated they would not be pursuing any action as
Youth B denied the allegations. I interviewed Youth B by telephone on 05/27/2021 and
3

Youth B denied the allegations and did not know why Youth A would have made the
allegations. Youth B also stated the staff were making room checks at the facility.
The room check log was reviewed and indicated room checks were being completed.
The time period in question indicated that at 12:00 and 12:15 all the youth were asleep.
Youth A was awake at 12:30 and Youth A did get up at 12:40 to go to the bathroom.
Additional room check times were 10:15, 10:30, 10:45, 11:00, 11:12, 11:29, 11:45,
12:40, 12:43, 1:00, 1:14, 1:28, 1:47, 2:01, 2:17, 2:30, 2:45, 3:01, 3:15, 3:30, 3:40, 3:58,
4:13, 4:30, 4:47, and 5:03.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio.
(4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside the direct
supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval
checks shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation did not provide adequate
evidence to substantiate the allegations made by Youth A.
Youth B has consistently denied the allegations. The facility did
provide documentation that room checks were being completed.
Both Youth A and Youth B reported the staff were providing
appropriate supervision and they described their time at this
facility as helpful/beneficial. The room check logs documented
that some room checks were being completed at intervals of
fifteen minutes or less, but some room checks were
documented as being completed outside the fifteen-minute
parameter established by this rule.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend with the submission and acceptance of an approved corrective action
plan the current license status of this child care institution-private be maintained.
05/28/2021
________________________________________
Mark R. Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
4

Approved By:
June 1, 2021
